revised_title: Equilibrium Conditions of Non-Stoichiometric Chemical Compounds
tldr: The author discusses the equilibrium conditions of non-stoichiometric chemical compounds, focusing on the effects of lattice defects and the interactions between them. They propose a model that considers the simplest approximation of defect interactions and show that a crystalline phase is stable only within a limited range of compositions. This model helps predict the occurrence of two-phase regions in equilibrium diagrams and describes the temperature dependence of miscibility in non-stoichiometric phases.
